‘tidbrock - true advertisement
on december 13, miss moore (rooser reeves’ secretary) called
to tell me that the billing on this advertisement was $468.59
less than the figures we had given to each of the companies
for their direct payment to tiderock.
on december 14, miss moore called to say that the amount
above wae not the complete billing since it did not include
the production costs. on december 21, she called with the
final production costes -- $1,112.14. the difference between
the credit due, per paragraph 1 and this amount was only
$643.55, and tiderock made payment to the agency by their
check, leaving this $643.55 balance to be figured into later
billings for the individual company payments.
if you agree, this can now be added to the payments due on
the barron's billings, thus clearing for now any payments due
from the companies direct to tiderock. i have checked with
mr. welle and there are no anticipated billings to be considered
other than those which are now covered in our 1968 budget.
pinal sheets, similar to the attached example, could be sent
to each of the companies involved, if you think it advisable.
the amounts we would now call on the companies for would be:

text:
economic importance of the tobacco industry to florida
the employment and income generated by the tobacco industry
in floeids should be constfered veo any proposal ie et
forwerd to raise the tax rate on cigarettes tl
resulting decline in sales will reduce the sales tax revenue and
the income generated in the state.
‘the sales of tobacco products in florida dur: 1985 hed
value of about $1,325 million, most of it in c! ette sales.
the income earned in florida's tobacco industry was in growing,
cigar menofecturing, leaf trading and processing. wholesale and
retail trade, and in the supplier industries. industry
placed close to $404 million of income into the hands of approzi-
mately 25,450 employees in 1983, according to the following dis-
tribution:
. over $10 million to more than 850 workers on
todacco farms and in suction warehouses,
. $46.6 million to 2,300 workers in ciser a=
facturing and to loaf buyers for the manufaccurers,
+ about $37 million to 1,550 wholesale employees who
distributed and stored products,
+ @lmost $121 million to 10,080 clerks who sell
tobaceo products, and
. more than $191 million to 10,660 employees in the
supplier industries.
major supplier industries in florida include wholesslers,
dusiness services, retailers, peper, machinery and equipment,
plastics, utilities, and finance.
‘the employees ert ing for covppliere provided products first
hand or indirectly through other suppliers wo, in turn, sold
goods and services to the tobacco industry.
the economic benefite did sot stop with the incoms generated
in these industries. tobacco related tax revenues to the state
amounted to more than $339 million, which ves a substantial
$.5 percent of florida's etate revenues. in addition, more then
$342 million was collected 2 the federal government in floride
from industry income, payroll, and excise taxes.

:
virginia slims 22nd anniversary match-up sweepstakes
quotation details
program dates: september & october 1990
| program description:

beginning in september, virginia slims will launch a 22nd
anniversary celebration sweepstakes in national magazines with an
interrupter spread ad. the involving ad asks consuners to =atch
up models with clues about tne date they appeared in magazines.

the objectives of the media ad are:

+ increase involverent with the brand

+ generate nares for the database

+ enhance the fun, upbeat and up-to-date image of virginia

siine
simultaneously, a retail promotion with the sweepstakes overlay
will be featured in pack cutlets nationwide. consurers will be
offered a free date book (address bock) with 2-pack purchase.
sweepstakes entry pads will be featured on the display header
cards. also, shelftalxers with sveepstakes entry pads wil! be
featured on shelves throughout each store. the objectives of the
retail program are:

+ increase sales

= encourage trial and continuity of purchase
= increase in-store presence and visibility
in september, virginia slims direct marketing department will be
sending out the third virginia slimeclub mailing to its 309,000
rembers. this fashion newsletter mailing will include the
sweepstakes. in addition, a total of 150,000 sweapstakes forms
will be offered at the southern women’s shows in the fall in taxe
cone holders.
to enter the sveepstakes, consurers are encouraged to get
involved with the ad by matching date clues to models prior to
sending away their naze for a chance to win. the following
prizes will be awarded from a random drawing:
